The four letters of 1865 are from Nashville, Tennesee, and Decatur, Alabama, and concern the sutlery business. In 1867, Hill was in Nashville, his occupation unclear. bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Oscar P. Hill was a sutler who followed and sold goods (tobacco, paper, etc.) to Union soldiers during the Civil War.
